channel.title: Recommend me a computer?
channel.description: Hey guys! I really want a new computer now, but I'm not sure what kind of computer I wanna buy. So, what computer could be good for programming?

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @neroxx neroxx
item.description:
@neroxx wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:41, topic:469100”][quote author=neroxx link=topic=586163.msg4163119#msg4163119 date=1353346538]

[quote author=RandQm link=topic=586163.msg4163084#msg4163084 date=1353344181]

I’m not really sure how much I want to spend on a computer. I just need some recommend programming computers I can look at.

do you need a mouse, keyboard, monitors, speakers and all the bells and whistles?

http://www.bit-tech.net/hardware/buyers-guide/2012/08/31/pc-hardware-buyer-s-guide-august-2012/1

have a look at the builds featured there, the cheapest build would be a fine pc assuming you don’t want to play the latest greatest games on highest resolution with the best gfx settings
[/quote]I have screen, mouse, keyboard and that. Actually, I just need the computer.

Give us some more information, are you expecting it to run games on ultra graphics smoothly, or don’t you game at all.
[/quote]I have no plans on using the computer for gaming. Or… It would only be for rsps or other games I learn to make in different languages. I’m pretty sure they wont be very big xD

If you’re low budget with all of this, you could easily build one for like ~$550. 8GB of RAM (If you will be testing programs that use a lot of memory), 500GB hard drive is all you will need (7200RPM), and a quad core CPU…[/quote]Allright, thanks Tyb

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“neroxx, post:40, topic:469100”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=586163.msg4163084#msg4163084 date=1353344181]

[quote author=neroxx link=topic=586163.msg4163060#msg4163060 date=1353343030]

I’m not really sure how much I want to spend on a computer. I just need some recommend programming computers I can look at.

do you need a mouse, keyboard, monitors, speakers and all the bells and whistles?

http://www.bit-tech.net/hardware/buyers-guide/2012/08/31/pc-hardware-buyer-s-guide-august-2012/1

have a look at the builds featured there, the cheapest build would be a fine pc assuming you don’t want to play the latest greatest games on highest resolution with the best gfx settings
[/quote]I have screen, mouse, keyboard and that. Actually, I just need the computer.

Give us some more information, are you expecting it to run games on ultra graphics smoothly, or don’t you game at all.
[/quote]I have no plans on using the computer for gaming. Or… It would only be for rsps or other games I learn to make in different languages. I’m pretty sure they wont be very big xD[/quote]
If you’re low budget with all of this, you could easily build one for like ~$550. 8GB of RAM (If you will be testing programs that use a lot of memory), 500GB hard drive is all you will need (7200RPM), and a quad core CPU…

Read full topic

Our regular guide to getting the best components for your PC build, whatever your budget.

have a look at the builds featured there, the cheapest build would be a fine pc assuming you don’t want to play the latest greatest games on highest resolution with the best gfx settings
[/quote]I have screen, mouse, keyboard and that. Actually, I just need the computer.[/quote]

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:33, topic:469100”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=586163.msg4162490#msg4162490 date=1353270398]

You would have to replace the whole MOBO if you wanted to replace the CPU… Since they are integrated…
[/quote]Which isn’t difficult.

You’ll do anything to get your right isn’t it.
It’s a fact that a laptop is much harder to work on and you don’t have the space to do/add a lot.[/quote]Yes, you don’t have virtually unlimited space like a desktop would have, but working on a laptop isn’t difficult.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

But not recommended, you could easily fuck something up.

Depends on the laptop I guess… I personally think it’s impractical to replace parts like that on a laptop anyways… Laptop technology is advancing so fast, that parts will eventually stop being made for whatever form factor you’re using. I mean, ultra-books have their own category on some electronic websites, they seem to becoming more and more independent than PC’s are.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:

You would have to replace the whole MOBO if you wanted to replace the CPU… Since they are integrated…
[/quote]Which isn’t difficult.[/quote]
You’ll do anything to get your right isn’t it.
It’s a fact that a laptop is much harder to work on and you don’t have the space to do/add a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

You can’t constantly upgrade parts within a laptop, though. Only RAM, power supply and HDD would be the most you could replace.

Yep…

You would have to replace the whole MOBO if you wanted to replace the CPU… Since they are integrated…

Read full topic

You can’t constantly upgrade parts within a laptop, though. Only RAM, power supply and HDD would be the most you could replace.

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:27, topic:469100”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=586163.msg4162479#msg4162479 date=1353269918]

[quote author=RandQm link=topic=586163.msg4162472#msg4162472 date=1353269607]

8GB is a little over the top. 4GB should be your minimum. It’s also pretty difficult to suggest a computer without knowing your budget.

You can never have to much RAM IMO… I’m always overloading with the 5GB that I have…
[/quote]I never said there’s such a thing as ‘too much RAM’, I said that a minimum of 8GB is a little over the top.

It is today, it wont in a few years and I don’t think every one is buying new computers every couple years
[/quote]Rebuild your computer when it’s outdated?

Why not doing it good from the first time instead, also then you need a desktop. Laptops are taking over the scene which is quit hard to work on hardware wise[/quote]I’ve only had a laptop for the past four years - laptop hardware isn’t hard to find or work on.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:

8GB is a little over the top. 4GB should be your minimum. It’s also pretty difficult to suggest a computer without knowing your budget.

You can never have to much RAM IMO… I’m always overloading with the 5GB that I have…
[/quote]I never said there’s such a thing as ‘too much RAM’, I said that a minimum of 8GB is a little over the top.

It is today, it wont in a few years and I don’t think every one is buying new computers every couple years
[/quote]Rebuild your computer when it’s outdated?[/quote]
Why not doing it good from the first time instead, also then you need a desktop. Laptops are taking over the scene which is quit hard to work on hardware wise

Read full topic

8GB is a little over the top. 4GB should be your minimum. It’s also pretty difficult to suggest a computer without knowing your budget.

You can never have to much RAM IMO… I’m always overloading with the 5GB that I have…
[/quote]I never said there’s such a thing as ‘too much RAM’, I said that a minimum of 8GB is a little over the top.[/quote]
It is today, it wont in a few years and I don’t think every one is buying new computers every couple years

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:22, topic:469100”]I don’t think you got what I meant, processing ability is fine, I’m just saying take into consideration how much physical memory the JVM uses, for each application. That much RAM is just fine for physical/virtual servers, but personal computers demand much more. You can run an RS2 server, but with that 2GB you have, I doubt the JVM would be able to allocate enough memory… Unless you like ran the server at 562MB, and the client on low memory, taking up about 1GB…[/quote]Shit… Yeah I completely misinterpreted what you were trying to get across. I agree.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I don’t think you got what I meant, processing ability is fine, I’m just saying take into consideration how much physical memory the JVM uses, for each application. That much RAM is just fine for physical/virtual servers, but personal computers demand much more. You can run an RS2 server, but with that 2GB you have, I doubt the JVM would be able to allocate enough memory… Unless you like ran the server at 562MB, and the client on low memory, taking up about 1GB…

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:20, topic:469100”][quote author=Uncalled link=topic=586163.msg4162394#msg4162394 date=1353266603]

[quote author=tyb97 link=topic=586163.msg4162389#msg4162389 date=1353266410]

8GB is a little over the top. 4GB should be your minimum. It’s also pretty difficult to suggest a computer without knowing your budget.

You can never have to much RAM IMO… I’m always overloading with the 5GB that I have…
[/quote]I never said there’s such a thing as ‘too much RAM’, I said that a minimum of 8GB is a little over the top.

Ohh, I see what you mean now.
[/quote]Honestly, if you have a good enough processor, you only need 2GB.

You couldn’t run more than a single RS2 server with that though, add a RS2 client, Minecraft client, or Minecraft server to that, and well you’re just outta luck…[/quote]Not if you have a good enough processor. I had a virtual server with only 1GB and it easily held over 200 players with room for more processes.

EDIT:
Unless it’s 32-bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Recommend me a computer?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:19, topic:469100”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=586163.msg4162389#msg4162389 date=1353266410]

[quote author=Uncalled link=topic=586163.msg4162367#msg4162367 date=1353265710]

8GB is a little over the top. 4GB should be your minimum. It’s also pretty difficult to suggest a computer without knowing your budget.

You can never have to much RAM IMO… I’m always overloading with the 5GB that I have…
[/quote]I never said there’s such a thing as ‘too much RAM’, I said that a minimum of 8GB is a little over the top.

Ohh, I see what you mean now.
[/quote]Honestly, if you have a good enough processor, you only need 2GB.[/quote]
You couldn’t run more than a single RS2 server with that though, add a RS2 client, Minecraft client, or Minecraft server to that, and well you’re just outta luck…

Read full topic
